name: Comfort Inn Fallsview

reviews.text: The rooms were tiny, the hot tub was cold, the breakfast had a line daily in a tiny room. The breakfast was so crowded, you shared your table with strangers. After 4 attempts to get ice out of the machine, I finally managed to get 1 small amount. But the largest problem, was the RUDE MANAGER. We were placed on the 8th floor with a balcony and children, we were moved to the only room left which was smaller and they would not adjust the room rate. Also, you need to get pool towels at the front desk instead of the pool area???? Too many headaches at this place if you are looking for a relaxing hotel stay. $6 to park-$9 after taxes each day!!
reviews.title: Save your money and find a better hotel

reviews.text: The front desk people messed up my reservation. They charged my credit card but didn't have it in there system. IThey said that I didn't pay for my stay when they actually did charge my card. SO at this point I called my credit card company to find out what was going on and they said that the hotel already charged my card before i even checked in! (I booked online) I was arguing with the manager for two hours trying to get my money back on my credit card and they were denying that they ever charged it!! They showed the WORST customer service that I have ever seen! So anyways, to make a very long and fustrating story short, I had to call my credit card company to refund back the amount that the hotel denied charging me in the first place and then just recharge me again and this time they had confirmation of it. Isn't that pathetic? They didn't even apoligize or anything! I will be complaining to Choice Hotels on this one for sure and never go back to this dump , rip off of a hotel ever again! Don't waste your money here.
reviews.title: DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

reviews.text: Overall a good experience. Staff was friendly and helpful, they let us know about fireworks and other fun activities for the kids. The room was clean and I slept wonderfully. Our room felt of average size and we had a little balcony. The breakfast was small, but hey it's free. Great hotel for family's.
reviews.title: Just right for our family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Convenient access to the falls. Helpful & friendly staff made the stay very comfortable.
reviews.title: Very Good Experience

reviews.text: We are frequent visitors to Niagara for short get always. This March break we hotel hopped and stayed at the Comfort Inn for one night, we found the room to be clean but small and older, the front desk staff was not the most friendly. They have free wireless internet that is weak at the best of times. They do have an indoor pool that is good for kids. The free breakfast in my opinion is a bit of a scam because it is only a continental breakfast that is offered only between 6:30-9:00am and you CAN NOT take anything up to your room, you MUST be fully dressed, NO PJ's. Why no PJ's at 6 in the morning when I can wear my neon blue Speedo from my 6th floor room down the elevator to the pool on the main floor ? Sorry but I will pass on the free muffin and coffee with those kind of restrictions. The one night stay was $70 including taxes (parking not included). We have free parking off site. No bad for the price but you can spend a little less for the same or spend a little more and get twice as much. We may return if our other spots are booked.
reviews.title: NOT BAD...... NOT GREAT.....JUST OK

reviews.text: We were quoted a price of $79. the first night and $99 for the second night (Friday and Saturday) so we booked it over the phone. When we arrived we were told that it would cost us $269. for the two nights. We told the staff what we were quoted on the phone and who we spoke to on the phone but it didn't matter to them. We had to put $100 deposit down plus $18 for parking. The staff told us we would get our deposit back upon checkout. The 3 people on the front desk couldn't decide how to book the room so we stood there and waited over 1/2 hour. The room was okay but the air conditioning was really noisy, the tv only had 20 channels available, 8 of the channels were news all the time and there were several french channels which left us with a choice of cartoons all day or two other channels.
reviews.title: Would not stay here again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went down to the pool which was nice but there were no towels in the pool room so when we were done we had to go soaking wet up to our room.
reviews.title: Not what you expected

reviews.text: Upon check out, we were not given our deposit back at all and found the staff rude and arguementative with us as well as a few other people who were checking out. For the money we paid I would recommend taking your business elsewhere because the staff there certainly don't seem to care about you.
reviews.title: It looks nicer in the Pic than in person

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price was extremely high. Over $200.00 a night for one bed in room. Not a view of the falls, just river. Yes it has a balcony, 5ftx5ft. No chairs. Bed had a top sheet for the bottom sheet, it kept coming off all night. Breakfast was not what we usually get at much lower priced hotel. No fresh fruit, just cereal, boiled eggs and toast. Only 7 tables, and a sign which said that food could not be taken out of the room. Had to give up our table to a woman with a walker, before we were done. Our room was next to the elevator, so not much sleep. Very disappointed, will not stay at another Comfort Inn.
reviews.title: Better Deals in Niagra Falls!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From outside the hotel looks really nice.
reviews.title: Wonderfull trip
Good Place To Stay
reviews.text: WE enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff was polite and helpful. Our room was spotless and cozy. And the included breakfast was very good. The attendant was very accommodating.

reviews.title: Very nice place to stay
reviews.text: The location was within walking distance to the falls and the caseno and was very resonably priced..

reviews.title: Reasonably priced and comfortable
reviews.text: Highly recomend and definitly would stay again.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Clean place to stay on a budget. Location of this hotel is very good and we were close to everything. We were greeted by friendly staff with smiles and checked us with no problems. The room was spacious and fairly clean. They have free wireless internet which doesn't work during our stay. This Comfort Inn also has the worst set-up for a continental breakfast that I have ever seen. But if you don't care about the Continental breakfast, I can recommend this hotel :)

reviews.title: Nice hotel but definately NO fallsview!
reviews.text: We were made welcome and the double room was quite adequate for our needs. Not really worth the extra we paid for a view of the falls as this is now largely obscured by neighbouring tower block hotels. (Fallsview is the district of town, don't be mislead). Get down early for the breakfast and you'll be OK.

Picked this hotel for location and cost - nice clean hotel with great bedding, but towels were small and thin compared to the plusher towels we are used to at other Comfort Inns. If you hope to get breakfast - which consists of cereal, milk, rolls, toast, hard boiled eggs, you MUST go early - before 8! Dining area is in a small room down a hot stuffy hallway (where the only 2 icemakers are - which run out of ice fast) with only 7 tables. You must wait to be seated by the hostess AND you caonnot take any food out of the room - she and the lady tending the food & tables enforces these rules. I only had to wait 5 minutes - at 8, but by the time I left there were a dozen people waiting outside. And, when my son came down at 9 - the line was all the way down the hall - even with people seeing the line and leaving - like we did! No business center and pools had short hours - 10 - 8 so those were disappointments, too.
reviews.title: Cheap but Cheap

reviews.text: Other than that, it was a good location - you can walk down past the casino to start your falls walk/tours, then when you get up to the visitor center and you are done - just catch the tram/lift (located inside visitor center) it takes you straight up the steep hill - runs every 5 -10 minutes for $2.50 each - then, you are just a block down from the hotel.
reviews.title: Comfort Inn saved this trip from disaster

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel is nothing short of amazing.They treat their patrons as the way thean't to be treated.I would like to thank Ken for giving me a deal on my room at 2am.I wasn't going to stay at super eight for another night.Parking is only 9 dollars compared to everyone elses 20 dollars.Ken was very understanding that I was dissapointed with another hotel and took care of the situation right away.The hotel is in a nice location on the main strip of the casino and close to all the good restaurants.The swimming pools are both good sized especially the outside one.When you need a towel,just ask the wonderfull staff at the desk.The only issue i have with the hotel is'their are fridges in the family suites and they aren't big.There is a free continental breakfast for the early risers like myself who read the paper and enjoy my coffee.Breakfast is severed from 6am to 9am.I would like to thank the staff for everything they did for saving my tip from being a total disaster.(kudos to Lucy and Jen at the front desk)
reviews.title: Not planning on staying here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all I need to say that I have no ax to grind. If you had a great stay here then I'm glad you did. That doesn't mean my review is wrong - we just had different experiences.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is close to the falls. However, in order to walk to them quickly you need to pay ($2.50) to take the little tram thing down. We chose to walk around so it took us on a much longer walk than we figured it would.
reviews.title: Never a disappointment

description: One block from Niagara Falls, this hotel is only a half-block from the new Fallsview Casino and only four blocks from Clifton Hill attractions. Guestrooms in this eight-story hotel include complimentary wireless Internet access and local calls, as well as cable TV. The Comfort Inn Fallsview offers indoor and outdoor pools, hot tubs and a patio. Complimentary continental breakfast is provided daily.
